chunks.zh: 丁克十年的感想
chunks.en: Thoughts after ten years of being DINK (Double Income No Kids)

chunks.zh: 最近丁克的贴子特别多，但是很少中年丁克出来表达，所以我想来澄清一下若干误解。
chunks.en: Recently, there have been many posts about DINKs, but few middle-aged DINKs have come out to express their views, so I want to clarify some misunderstandings.

chunks.zh: 我和老婆其实是喜欢小孩的，但丁克是我们的共同决定。
chunks.en: My wife and I actually like children, but being DINKs is our joint decision.

chunks.zh: 我们不论做什么选择都可以说是自私的，简单说下我为什么丁克：
chunks.en: Whatever choice we make can be said to be selfish, so let me briefly explain why I am a DINK:

chunks.zh: 1. 养孩子需要很多精力，我把这些精力投入到爱好中，获得的幸福感会多得多
chunks.en: 1. Raising children requires a lot of energy. If I put this energy into my hobbies, I will get much more happiness.

chunks.zh: 2. 生养孩子在中国非常费钱，影响我躺平
chunks.en: 2. Raising children in China is very expensive, which affects my ability to 'lie flat' (live a minimalist life).

chunks.zh: 3. 现在学校中的教育太多不科学，政治偏向越来越多，我如果成为家长会和老师发生冲突
chunks.en: 3. The education in schools now is too unscientific, with more and more political bias. If I were a parent, I would clash with teachers.

chunks.zh: 接下来分析一下大家误解最多的几个观点：
chunks.en: Next, let's analyze some of the most misunderstood points:

chunks.zh: ## 丁克是因为缺钱，到中年不缺钱了会想要小孩
chunks.en: ## Being DINKs is because they lack money; when they reach middle age and have money, they will want children.

chunks.zh: 如果你有这个观点，说明你一开始就不想丁克。
chunks.en: If you have this view, it means you didn't actually want to be a DINK in the first place.

chunks.zh: 我家现在不缺钱，但大部分精力和花费都投入了爱好。
chunks.en: My family is not short of money now, but most of my energy and expenses are invested in hobbies.

chunks.zh: 这里问题的关键是你有没有爱好来充实生活，而不是钱。
chunks.en: The key issue here is whether you have hobbies to enrich your life, not money.

chunks.zh: 如果你经常感到无聊，看到别人养孩子的快乐瞬间自然也会想养一个。
chunks.en: If you often feel bored, you will naturally want to raise a child when you see the happy moments of others raising children.

chunks.zh: 但理性思考一下，养孩子占用很多固定时间，会比看书、写作、画画之类灵活分配时间的爱好带来更多快乐吗？
chunks.en: But think rationally, does raising children, which takes up a lot of fixed time, bring more happiness than hobbies like reading, writing, and painting, which allow for flexible time allocation?

chunks.zh: 这里说的爱好不是娱乐，刷短视频、看微博、旅游、吃美食等等是几乎每个人都喜欢的娱乐，爱好是需要花费精力以提升或者深入为目标的，可以让人长时间保持激情和专注。
chunks.en: The hobbies mentioned here are not entertainment. Watching short videos, surfing Weibo, traveling, eating delicious food, etc. are entertainment that almost everyone likes. Hobbies are things that require effort to improve or delve into, and they can keep people passionate and focused for a long time.

chunks.zh: 拿跑步来举例，每天逼着自己跑几公里保持健康，算不上爱好，顶多是个好习惯，但是如果有全马完赛时间目标，并且列出课表坚持训练，就属于爱好。
chunks.en: Take running as an example. Forcing yourself to run a few kilometers every day to stay healthy doesn't count as a hobby; at most, it's a good habit. But if you have a goal of finishing a full marathon within a certain time and you create a schedule and stick to it for training, that's a hobby.

chunks.zh: 这种目标会让你四处收集跑步相关的新闻和资料，占用很多思考时间，而全马 PB 带来的心理满足感和身体健康就不用多说了。
chunks.en: This kind of goal will make you collect news and information about running everywhere, occupy a lot of thinking time, and the psychological satisfaction and physical health brought by a full marathon PB (personal best) go without saying.

chunks.zh: ## 丁克相当于放弃一部分社会关系
chunks.en: ## Being DINKs is equivalent to giving up a part of social relationships.

chunks.zh: 这和上一条所说的爱好关系密切。
chunks.en: This is closely related to the hobbies mentioned in the previous point.

chunks.zh: 大部分打工人的社交基本就是同事和亲戚，两部分人都是你无法选择的，很难遇到三观一致和玩得开心的人。
chunks.en: Most working people's social interactions are basically with colleagues and relatives. Both groups are people you cannot choose, and it is difficult to meet people who have the same values and are fun to be with.

chunks.zh: 而有了爱好就不同，比如我和老婆玩越野跑、徒步、攀岩，基本每次活动都能认识陌生人交换联系方式，成为朋友后，他们还会介绍新朋友来扩大圈子，如果不想浪费太多时间，必须得精心选择几个来深入交流。
chunks.en: But with hobbies, it's different. For example, my wife and I do trail running, hiking, and rock climbing. We basically meet strangers and exchange contact information at every activity. After becoming friends, they will introduce new friends to expand the circle. If we don't want to waste too much time, we have to carefully choose a few to have in-depth exchanges with.

chunks.zh: 最重要的是，这些朋友是我选的，能理解我的追求，甚至和我目标一致且与我并肩努力。
chunks.en: Most importantly, these friends are people I chose, who can understand my pursuits, even have the same goals as me, and work hard alongside me.

chunks.zh: 另外有了爱好你根本不需要过多的社会关系，绝大部分时间我都喜欢独处，比如微信读书看了几百本书，豆瓣标记了两千多部电影，如果我想在书和电影上交流，那我更愿意上豆瓣评论。
chunks.en: In addition, with hobbies, you don't need too much social interaction at all. Most of the time, I like to be alone. For example, I have read hundreds of books on WeChat Reading, and marked more than two thousand movies on Douban. If I want to exchange views on books and movies, I would rather go to Douban comments.

chunks.zh: ## 丁克老了之后不好过
chunks.en: ## DINKs won't live well when they get old.

chunks.zh: 这个观点其实大部分人亲身反对了，因为他们的非丁克父母老了也不好过。
chunks.en: This view is actually refuted by most people's own experiences, because their non-DINK parents don't live well when they get old either.

chunks.zh: 作为孩子需要离家去大城市打工，偶尔过节回家，并且他们精力主要投入在自己的孩子身上，很难照顾到老人。
chunks.en: As children, they need to leave home to work in big cities, occasionally go home for holidays, and their energies are mainly invested in their own children, making it difficult to take care of the elderly.

chunks.zh: 老了之后孩子会不会对你好暂且不说，谈谈健康和养老问题。
chunks.en: Let's leave aside whether the children will treat you well when you get old and talk about health and elder care.

chunks.zh: 一般人会投入 30-50 岁这段人生来养孩子，65 岁可能身体状况就会变差。
chunks.en: Most people will invest the period of their lives from 30-50 years old in raising children, and their physical condition may deteriorate at 65.

chunks.zh: 很多 30 岁左右的打工人就会出现肥胖、三高、腰椎间盘突出之类的病，我目前四十多岁也还没有任何病症，主因是运动量大，睡眠充足。
chunks.en: Many working people around 30 years old will have diseases such as obesity, high blood pressure, high blood sugar, and lumbar disc herniation. I am currently in my forties and have not had any symptoms, mainly because I exercise a lot and get enough sleep.

chunks.zh: 并不是说多运动就能不得病，只是概率会小得多。
chunks.en: It's not that more exercise will prevent you from getting sick, it just makes the probability much smaller.

chunks.zh: 另外我的体脂 10%左右，正手引体向上 30 个以上，全马 310 ，相信即使到 70 岁也会比大多数 30 岁的人身体素质好，还需要在意养老问题吗？
chunks.en: In addition, my body fat is around 10%, I can do more than 30 pull-ups with an overhand grip, and my full marathon time is 3 hours and 10 minutes. I believe that even at 70, I will be in better physical condition than most 30-year-olds. Do I still need to worry about elder care?

chunks.zh: 因为我主要玩耐力运动和攀岩，体重不大，肌肉不多，外表显年轻，很多陌生人会误以为我二十多岁，这可能也是丁克的一大优势。
chunks.en: Because I mainly do endurance sports and rock climbing, I don't weigh much, don't have much muscle, and look young. Many strangers mistake me for being in my twenties, which may be a major advantage of being a DINK.

chunks.zh: ## 丁克就不应该结婚
chunks.en: ## DINKs shouldn't get married.

chunks.zh: 持这种观点的人没有理解国外同性恋婚姻合法追求的是什么，肯定也是理解不了各种平权斗争的。
chunks.en: People who hold this view don't understand what the legalization of same-sex marriage abroad is pursuing, and they certainly don't understand various struggles for equal rights.

chunks.zh: 而且婚姻的法律效益带来的不仅是心理上的安全感，它是和重疾险类似的一个保障，你目前再幸福也无法保证婚姻是永远稳定的。
chunks.en: Moreover, the legal benefits of marriage bring not only psychological security, but it is also a guarantee similar to critical illness insurance. No matter how happy you are now, you cannot guarantee that the marriage will always be stable.

chunks.zh: 另外婚姻带来了稳定的关系，大量论文都证实了稳定关系对健康的巨大收益，各种心理学书籍比如《亲密关系》也讲过。
chunks.en: In addition, marriage brings stable relationships, and many papers have confirmed the huge benefits of stable relationships for health. Various psychology books, such as 'Intimate Relationships', have also talked about this.

chunks.zh: ## 选择丁克的男人就应该去结扎
chunks.en: ## Men who choose to be DINKs should get a vasectomy.

chunks.zh: 这种观点本身就是非黑即白的，如同“如果你不喜欢开车，那你就把驾驶执照注销”一样极端。
chunks.en: This view itself is black and white, as extreme as 'If you don't like driving, then you should cancel your driver's license'.

chunks.zh: 首先说明我本身明白结扎不会影响身体健康，并且乐意结扎，但一直没结扎是因为老婆不让。
chunks.en: First of all, let me state that I understand that vasectomy will not affect my health, and I am willing to get a vasectomy, but I haven't had one because my wife won't let me.

chunks.zh: 之前说过我们本身喜欢孩子，如果哪天政|府变得像北欧、冰岛那样民主法治，我们很可能会生，当然我知道概率比中六合彩要小。
chunks.en: I said before that we like children very much. If one day the government becomes as democratic and rule-of-law as in Northern Europe and Iceland, we are very likely to have children, but of course I know that the probability is smaller than winning the lottery.

chunks.zh: 生育是两个人的事情，只要商量一致，没什么不可以的。
chunks.en: Having children is a matter for two people. As long as they agree, nothing is impossible.

chunks.zh: 如果你拒绝繁衍和传承，国家的未来将与你无关，那你的意见对国家的未来将毫无意义，国家不能也不会交到你们手里。
chunks.en: If you refuse to reproduce and pass on your genes, the future of the country will be irrelevant to you, then your opinion on the future of the country will be meaningless, and the country cannot and will not be handed over to you.

chunks.zh: 这句话很搞笑，为什么不再拔高点：如果你拒绝繁衍和传承，人类的未来将与你无关；如果你拒绝繁衍与传承，哺乳动物的未来将与你无关；如果你拒绝繁衍和传承，地球生物的未来将与你无关。。。🤣
chunks.en: This sentence is very funny, why not raise the bar even higher: if you refuse to reproduce and pass on your genes, the future of mankind will be irrelevant to you; if you refuse to reproduce and pass on your genes, the future of mammals will be irrelevant to you; if you refuse to reproduce and pass on your genes, the future of life on Earth will be irrelevant to you...🤣

chunks.zh: 写的不错，每个论点都逻辑清晰，尊重自己才能尊重他人，所以我觉得这类人就算不丁克也是会充分尊重小孩儿的，反而真正嘴里天天喊着家庭责任、社会责任的人，连基本的尊重小孩儿都做不到，只当做自己的附属品、终身玩偶、投资标的。（绝大部分，非全部）
chunks.en: Well written, each argument is logically clear. You can only respect others if you respect yourself, so I think that even if these people are not DINKs, they will fully respect children. On the contrary, those who shout about family responsibility and social responsibility every day can't even give children basic respect and only treat them as their accessories, lifelong dolls, and investment targets (mostly, but not all).

chunks.zh: 丁克不自私，至少比嘴上挂着大义的父母好多了。
chunks.en: DINKs are not selfish, at least they are better than parents who talk about righteousness all the time.

chunks.zh: 他们生孩子的每一个理由都是自私的。
chunks.en: Every reason they have for having children is selfish.

chunks.zh: 我看楼上的一些回复，突然想问一句：大家对同性恋什么看法？
chunks.en: I see some of the replies above and suddenly want to ask: what are everyone's views on homosexuality?

chunks.zh: 丁不丁克，结不结婚，喜欢同性还是异性，有正确答案吗？
chunks.en: Is there a right answer to whether to be DINKs, get married, or prefer the same or opposite sex?

chunks.zh: 我觉得这与豆腐脑吃甜的还是咸的，粽子吃甜的还是咸的是同一类问题。
chunks.en: I think this is the same kind of question as whether to eat sweet or salty tofu pudding, or whether to eat sweet or salty zongzi.

chunks.zh: 爱吃什么就吃什么呗！
chunks.en: Eat whatever you like!

chunks.zh: 丁克与否问题最大的不同是不能后悔。
chunks.en: The biggest difference with the DINK issue is that you can't regret it.

chunks.zh: 我今天吃甜豆腐脑，明天可以换阵营到咸豆腐脑党。
chunks.en: I can eat sweet tofu pudding today and switch to the salty tofu pudding party tomorrow.

chunks.zh: 但是孩子生下来塞不回去，或者年纪大了就来不及了、生不了了，阵营很难更改。
chunks.en: But once the child is born, you can't put them back in, or it's too late or you can't have them when you get older, it's difficult to change camps.

chunks.zh: 谁也没走过对方的路，所以谁也不无法验证哪条路更好。
chunks.en: No one has walked the other person's path, so no one can verify which path is better.

chunks.zh: 搞笑的是，有些人可能会后悔，但又不敢承认自己选错了路，于是拼命要证明自己的选择才是最好的选择。
chunks.en: The funny thing is that some people may regret it, but they don't dare to admit that they chose the wrong path, so they desperately try to prove that their choice is the best choice.

chunks.zh: 但是回到最初的问题：这个选择有正确答案吗？
chunks.en: But back to the original question: is there a right answer to this choice?

chunks.zh: 看这几天的帖子，我觉得有些人认为有正确答案，他们要证明自己的选择没错。
chunks.en: Looking at the posts these past few days, I think some people think there is a right answer, they want to prove that their choice is correct.

chunks.zh: 但我不这么认为：有个屁的最好的选择，连什么是好都无法定义。
chunks.en: But I don't think so: there's no such thing as the best choice, you can't even define what's good.

chunks.zh: 可能双方都有对号入座的人，都要踩我，「假装理中客」「那你是走了哪条路，你有没有后悔？」
chunks.en: Maybe there are people on both sides who will identify with this and step on me, [pretending to be neutral and rational] [which path did you take, do you regret it?]

chunks.zh: 我还不算年迈，还有机会做选择，所以我也不好说我最终会走哪条路，也说不准以后会不会后悔走的那条路。
chunks.en: I'm not old yet, I still have the opportunity to choose, so I can't say which path I will eventually take, and I can't say whether I will regret taking that path in the future.

chunks.zh: 但是，无论我做什么选择，都不干其他人的事儿了，更不干国家政府的事儿了。
chunks.en: But, whatever choice I make, it's none of other people's business, and it's even less the business of the national government.

chunks.zh: 无论我是否繁衍传承，我都在纳税，我的意见对国家就有意义；我确实不关心国家长远的未来，但我关心国家的现在和有限期的未来；我要求享受政府提供给公民的权利是因为我履行了该履行的义务，而这个义务里似乎并不包括我必须繁衍。
chunks.en: Whether I reproduce and pass on my genes or not, I am paying taxes, so my opinion matters to the country; I do not care about the long-term future of the country, but I care about the present and the limited future of the country; I demand to enjoy the rights provided by the government to citizens because I fulfill the obligations that I should fulfill, and this obligation does not seem to include that I must reproduce.

chunks.zh: 同样，无论我是否要繁衍，也与国家政府无关——我认同楼主所说的大部分内容，但有关躺平和政治政府的部分无法认同——也与之前那个帖子所说的建立社会关系无关。
chunks.en: Similarly, whether I want to reproduce or not is also irrelevant to the national government - I agree with most of what the original poster said, but I cannot agree with the parts about 'lying flat' and political government - and it is also irrelevant to the establishment of social relations mentioned in the previous post.

chunks.zh: 如果我不能确定我可以养育好一个孩子，那么我就不会生。
chunks.en: If I'm not sure I can raise a child well, then I won't have one.

chunks.zh: 别说生孩子，前面七八年在外边一直漂着，我连宠物都没有领养，直到今年我算是有个住所了我才动了养只宠物的念头。
chunks.en: Not to mention having children, I've been floating around outside for the past seven or eight years, I haven't even adopted a pet, and it wasn't until this year that I had a place to live that I had the idea of ​​getting a pet.

chunks.zh: 如果我选择生孩子，那肯定是我能确定我可以养育好孩子了。
chunks.en: If I choose to have children, it will definitely be because I am sure that I can raise the child well.

chunks.zh: 生不生孩子与其他所有的因素都无关，只与那个孩子有关。
chunks.en: Whether to have a child or not has nothing to do with all other factors, it only has to do with that child.

chunks.zh: 因为担心晚年不快乐不幸福所以要生个孩子以防万一？
chunks.en: Because you are worried about being unhappy and unhappy in your old age, you want to have a child just in case?

chunks.zh: 因为人生后半段社会关系少需要建立新的社会关系所以生个孩子？
chunks.en: Because there are few social relationships in the second half of life and you need to build new social relationships, you have a child?

chunks.zh: 因为担心养育孩子太影响自己的生活所以不生孩子？
chunks.en: Because you are worried that raising children will affect your life too much, you don't have children?

chunks.zh: 这也太自私了吧？！
chunks.en: Isn't that too selfish?!

chunks.zh: 因为担心生活环境太恶劣所以不敢生孩子？
chunks.en: Because you are worried that the living environment is too harsh, you dare not have children?

chunks.zh: 这样太不自信了吧？！
chunks.en: Isn't that too unconfident?!

chunks.zh: 多解释一句，我所谓的养育孩子，不知道你们能不能理解。
chunks.en: Just to explain further, I don't know if you can understand what I mean by raising children.

chunks.zh: 因为我奶奶的观念是，生孩子养孩子嘛，养活就行。
chunks.en: Because my grandma's idea is that when you have children, just raise them to survive.

chunks.zh: 我无法认同她这个观念。
chunks.en: I can't agree with her idea.

chunks.zh: 说是养育，更应该说是我能不能成为一个合格的父母，能不能让这个生命养成为一个合格的人。
chunks.en: Speaking of raising, it should be more about whether I can become a qualified parent, and whether I can raise this life into a qualified person.

chunks.zh: 当然，这里的两个合格也很难精确定义。
chunks.en: Of course, it is difficult to precisely define the two 'qualified' here.

chunks.zh: 我现在自认我还不够合格，别说做合格的父母，连做合格的伴侣我都认为我做不到。
chunks.en: I don't think I'm qualified enough now, not to mention being a qualified parent, I don't even think I can be a qualified partner.

chunks.zh: 所以我现在暂时还是选择不婚，不生。
chunks.en: So I'm still choosing not to marry and not to have children for now.

chunks.zh: 如果哪天我自觉我够格了，同时遇到了合适的伴侣，我也许会改变主意。
chunks.en: If I feel qualified enough someday, and I meet a suitable partner, I may change my mind.

chunks.zh: 不过目前看起来，此生无望。
chunks.en: But it looks like there is no hope in this life.

chunks.zh: @w99wjacky 我替美国人回应（设计对白）：笑死，你生孩子，国家就会把未来交到你手里？
chunks.en: @w99wjacky I'll respond for the Americans (fabricated dialogue): Laughable, you think if you have children, the country will hand over the future to you?

chunks.zh: 美国的官员本质上都是资本家，就等着你们的孩子给他们剥削而已。
chunks.en: American officials are essentially capitalists, just waiting for your children to be exploited by them.

chunks.zh: 非杠精，这句话很可能不正确："结扎不会影响身体健康"。
chunks.en: Not trying to be a contrarian, but this statement is likely incorrect: 'Vasectomy does not affect physical health'.

chunks.zh: 结扎可能会导致无精症
chunks.en: Vasectomy can lead to azoospermia.

chunks.zh: @w99wjacky 1. 普通人根本不需要对民族负多大的责任。
chunks.en: @w99wjacky 1. Ordinary people don't need to bear much responsibility for the nation.

chunks.zh: 责任与权利必须对等，制定政策的人没能让大家轻松生活，结果责任让一个无权无势的底层人承担？
chunks.en: Responsibility and rights must be equal. Those who make policies have failed to make life easier for everyone, and as a result, the responsibility is borne by powerless and uninfluential common people?

chunks.zh: 2. 美国经济腾飞，经济发展的结果不是为了给美国人套上枷锁吧？
chunks.en: 2. The American economy is booming, the result of economic development isn't to put shackles on Americans, right?

chunks.zh: 经济发展的结果难道不是应该让人更自由吗？
chunks.en: Shouldn't the result of economic development be to make people more free?

chunks.zh: 在美国（ V 站服务器在美国）发这样一个帖子，应该是自由的吧，选择生或不生，应该是自由的吧？
chunks.en: Posting such a post in the United States (V2EX's server is in the United States) should be free, right? Choosing to have children or not to have children should be free, right?

chunks.zh: 美国宪法你研究一下。
chunks.en: Study the US Constitution.

chunks.zh: 3. 一个国家真的强大了，还怕没人来生孩子？
chunks.en: 3. If a country is really strong, is it still afraid that no one will have children?

chunks.zh: 多少人挤破脑袋想去美国生孩子，还怕丁克？
chunks.en: So many people are trying to have children in the United States, are you still afraid of DINKs?

chunks.zh: 4. 按你这个逻辑，不 996 拼搏，有人说自己想躺平，也是对民族不负责任？
chunks.en: 4. According to your logic, working without 996 (9am to 9pm, 6 days a week), if someone says they want to 'lie flat', is that also irresponsible to the nation?

chunks.zh: V 站好多人好魔怔，一个陌生人聊了下个人选择，吹胡子瞪眼的，人身攻击的，一定肯定必然绝对一堆肯定性词语不容反驳，像极了被家长管制过渡的孩子极尽努力的去掌控别人的生活。
chunks.en: Many people on V2EX (this site) are so obsessed. A stranger talked about a personal choice, and they started yelling, making personal attacks, and using a bunch of definitive words that allow no refutation, just like children who have been over-controlled by their parents trying their best to control other people's lives.

chunks.zh: 想起去年在某个主题下说了几句新能源汽车的劣势，一个人几乎想要顺着网线爬过来把我掐死，为啥都那么用力啊
chunks.en: I remember last year when I said a few words about the disadvantages of new energy vehicles under a certain topic, a person almost wanted to climb along the network cable to strangle me to death. Why is everyone so forceful?

chunks.zh: @w99wjacky “享受了中国经济腾飞的几十年“ 幽默还得是您幽默
chunks.en: @w99wjacky 'Enjoyed the decades of China's economic take-off' You're really humorous.

chunks.zh: @cmdOptionKana 对于国家/政府/经济，所有这一切的底层基础就是人矿，是的，99.9999999%的人都是人矿。
chunks.en: @cmdOptionKana For a country/government/economy, the underlying basis of all this is 'human resources', yes, 99.9999999% of people are 'human resources'.

chunks.zh: 在哪个国家都一样。
chunks.en: It's the same in every country.

chunks.zh: 没有什么共产主义接班人，也没有资本主义的接班人，大部分都是人矿。
chunks.en: There are no communist successors, nor capitalist successors, most are 'human resources'.

chunks.zh: 世界秩序在变坏，中国人口在加速老龄化。
chunks.en: The world order is getting worse, and China's population is aging rapidly.

chunks.zh: 丁克无可厚非，到时候一闭眼一蹬腿，和常人无异。
chunks.en: Being DINK is understandable, when the time comes, you'll close your eyes and kick your legs, the same as everyone else.

chunks.zh: 可要是宣扬这样的态度对待中国/中华民族，自己享受了中国经济腾飞的几十年，然后让所有人都学自己，赤裸裸的来，一身轻的走，我觉得这对于我们这个民族来说，算得上是不负责任。
chunks.en: But if you advocate this attitude towards China/ the Chinese nation, if you have enjoyed the decades of China's economic take-off and then let everyone follow you, coming naked and leaving easily, I think this can be regarded as irresponsible to our nation.

chunks.zh: 附一句星球大战的话：Long live and prosper.
chunks.en: Attached is a quote from Star Wars: Long live and prosper.

chunks.zh: “相信即使到 70 岁也会比大多数 30 岁的人身体素质好”这认知水平还在这写分析呢？
chunks.en: 'Believe that even at 70, you will be in better physical condition than most 30-year-olds' - and this guy is writing analysis with this level of awareness?

chunks.zh: 在加一句现任美国副总统对“无孩爱猫女”的态度：如果你拒绝繁衍和传承，国家的未来将与你无关，那你的意见对国家的未来将毫无意义，国家不能也不会交到你们手里。
chunks.en: Here's another quote from the current US Vice President regarding the attitude towards 'childless cat-loving women': If you refuse to reproduce and pass on your genes, the future of the country will be irrelevant to you, then your opinion on the future of the country will be meaningless, and the country cannot and will not be handed over to you.

chunks.zh: @w99wjacky #12 什么叫“自己享受了中国经济腾飞的几十年”，如果是直接生在“发达”国家，那可以这么说，但事实是中国的发展正是“我们”创造的，而不是“我们”享受了几十年，是国家亏欠了“我们”这一代，而不是“我们”愧对国家
chunks.en: @w99wjacky #12 What do you mean by 'enjoyed decades of China's economic take-off'? If you were born directly in a 'developed' country, you could say that, but the fact is that China's development was created by 'us', not that 'we' enjoyed it for decades. The country owes it to 'our' generation, not that 'we' are sorry to the country.

chunks.zh: @chiaf 没毛病，你不生孩子，人类的未来怎么跟你扯上关系
chunks.en: @chiaf No problem, if you don't have children, how does the future of humanity relate to you?

chunks.zh: OP 的几年，可能是普通人一辈子都无法感受的。
chunks.en: The OP's few years may be something ordinary people can't experience in a lifetime.

chunks.zh: 从质量上，OP 的生命是长的，普通人可能就是 差不多的日子，重复了 七十年。
chunks.en: In terms of quality, the OP's life is long, while ordinary people may just repeat similar days for seventy years.

chunks.zh: 一堆糟心事，老了百病缠身，往返医院和药铺之间，咽气之前发现白活了，后悔不已。
chunks.en: A bunch of upsetting things, plagued by illnesses when they get old, shuttling between hospitals and pharmacies, and discovering that they have lived in vain and regretting it before they take their last breath.

chunks.zh: @F798 是呀，毕竟生出来的孩子不可能塞回肚子里，打死都不能承认后悔。
chunks.en: @F798 Yes, after all, you can't put a child back in your stomach once it's born, you can't admit regret even if you're beaten to death.

chunks.zh: @w99wjacky #12 脸都不要了，享受指的是 996 一辈子买不到一套房吗？
chunks.en: @w99wjacky #12 You have no shame, does 'enjoying' mean working 996 and not being able to buy a house in your entire life?

chunks.zh: 满嘴仁义道德的恰恰是人渣。
chunks.en: Those who are full of benevolence and morality are precisely scumbags.

chunks.zh: 你多生点。
chunks.en: You have more children.

chunks.zh: 看不懂楼上趾高气昂的反对，甚至上升到了人身攻击，还有莫名其妙的宏大叙事。
chunks.en: I don't understand the condescending opposition upstairs, which even escalated to personal attacks and inexplicably grand narratives.

chunks.zh: 这不是一种个人选择吗？
chunks.en: Isn't this a personal choice?

chunks.zh: lz 想怎么选怎么选，又没有站出来让看到帖子的人都和他一样选择丁克，怎么这么多人急了呢，看到这篇帖子我甚至以为我不是在 v 站，而是在微博/抖音评论区。
chunks.en: The original poster can choose whatever they want, and they didn't stand up and ask everyone who saw the post to choose to be a DINK like them, so why are so many people anxious? Seeing this post, I even thought I wasn't on V2EX, but in the WeChat/TikTok comments section.

chunks.zh: 这么多人迫不及待得想当 lz 的爹来教育一下他，让他赶紧生孩子，可是和你又有什么关系呢？
chunks.en: So many people can't wait to act like the original poster's father to educate him and tell him to have children quickly, but what does it have to do with you?

chunks.zh: 至于那些理由，你信不信又有什么关系呢？
chunks.en: As for those reasons, what does it matter if you believe it or not?

chunks.zh: lz 又没有卖课，也没有卖货，你信了如何，不信又如何呢？
chunks.en: The original poster is not selling courses or goods, so what if you believe it or not?

chunks.zh: 不行你去报警吧。
chunks.en: If it doesn't work, go call the police.

chunks.zh: 祝好，人是会变的
chunks.en: Best wishes, people change

chunks.zh: @emSaVya 中国经济近几十年腾飞不是事实吗？
chunks.en: @emSaVya Isn't it a fact that the Chinese economy has taken off in recent decades?

chunks.zh: 看样子你没享受到，你急了
chunks.en: Looks like you didn't enjoy it, you're anxious.
